content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good idea!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice clash, especially for shortest as there are many solutions to think of

you should rename the tests
you put all the validators as "Test X" so test cases tests would show up as:
Test1, Test3, Test5, Test7 since validators don't show up to user while solving

instead name them "Test 1 - Validator 1"
when you fix this I can approve :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: simple yet not too simple, was able to put together a solution for this in C# in about 4 lines but with a fair amount of Linq, was a fun one to solve
Seems simple at first but adds a twist to it as you cant just sort by ASCII character code because the digits need to be at the end, nice work

I'm a little tired today so I was unable to read your comment with 100% certainty this is what you meant, but I believe I understand what you're talking about. When in the reverse mode it only gives you the tests, not the validators so they're numbered oddly. I believe it should be fixed.

in any mode it gives you only the tests, validators are hidden, they are the validation checks ran after submitting the solution
and usually validators are similar in complexity or solve similar part of the problem as the test connected to it
